title: Duplex Rocker Combination Decorator Switch,120VAC 15Amp,Ground Terminal,Residential/Commercial Grade,2 Individual Switches,UL Listed,Pack of 2,White

product_information.Best Sellers Rank: Best Sellers Rank:  #25,542 in Tools & Home Improvement (See Top 100 in Tools & Home Improvement)    #91 in Electrical Light Switches       #91 in Electrical Light Switches

description: Wengart combination switch is perfect for any area of the home. Its simple and practical design will help you save space in any area of your home. This switch is sleek and its impact-resistant exterior ensures a long life. This combination decorative switch has a light-colored body that fits into a standard junction box, and it's made of polycarbonate thermoplastic (PCT) material for durability. PCT makes this wall plate resistant up to 140 degrees C, so there's no need to worry about the material melting or fading. This dual switch is easy to install and can replace a regular decorative switch for more control over more appliances. Control lights and fans from the same location. These switches are perfect for turning on ventilation fans and lights separately in the bathroom, or switching cabinet lights and overhead lights separately in the kitchen. Specification: Voltage：AC120V-277VCurrent：15AType:Double Paddle SwitchTerminal:Hot, Load, Ground TerminalsWiring:Back Wiring, Use with up to 12AWG
shipping_info: FREE Wednesday, June 11 on orders shipped by Amazon over $35
product_category: Tools & Home Improvement›Electrical›Switches & Dimmers›Wall Switches›Light Switches
feature_bullets: These combination switches can easily manage multiple devices, you only need one switch to control exhaust fans, lights, heaters, night lights, etc., saving space
Constructed of impact resistant polycarbonate thermoplastic and solid steel for extended life, these light switches are UL/cUL Listed for your peace of mind

These 2 position rocker switches blend seamlessly with your existing switches and decor for a sleek, modern look and are suitable for residential use and most commercial areas where only a 15A switch is required
These 2-position rocker switches feature side wiring options, snap-off plaster lugs for flush alignment, and a shallow body design that fits standard junction boxes for easy installation
Enjoy smooth and accurate on/off control with these 2-position rocker switches with excellent tactile feedback, preventing accidental flipping.

customer_reviews.review_title: 5.0 out of 5 starsWell-made switches at a decent price.
customer_reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on May 22, 2025
customer_reviews.review_snippet: This switch works just fine. Well-made. Good value.

customer_reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on May 2, 2025

customer_reviews.review_title: 4.0 out of 5 starsUsed and didnt work at first
customer_reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on December 1, 2024
customer_reviews.review_snippet: I'm thinking i might have received a Returned item. Had a weird "burnt" plastic (circuit board) smell. Used one and worked fine. Hooked up a bathroom heat/vent/light combo. One switch i hooked up the vent (to one switch) and light (to other switch).Then installed the other switch on my main bathroom light and wired in the heater portion, that way I don't max out the amperage on one circuit.At first the second install, i had put the "line" to the brass screw and the "loads" to the other switch's (heater and light respectively). Turned on the breaker then one on the switch and both the heater and light came on. It baffled me for a good while. I rechecked all my wiring in the gang box and in the attic for the heat/vent/light combo. All wiring was correct.Then i went out to Lowes to buy another, Eaton, hooked it up and i did the same thing. So i decided to read the instructions very carefully. It stated, "to run the single pole double switch as two INDEPENDANTLY switches, break off the copper tab between the two loads!"That was the KEY! i looked on the Eaton switch and this one and sure enough on the load side, there it was. I took my flathead screwdriver, small, and wedged it in per the instructions and a simple up, down, and back up again then the tab broke off.Now it works fine.How i know this was prob a returned item? The first switch i installed, i didn't have to break the load tabs off because someone else did it for me!They work great now after about 2hrs of troubleshooting, climbing up and down from the attic, turning on and off the breakers to switch the line wires around ect...The single pole 3 switch didn't have the break off tab so idk what gives? It's not like this is or was a 2-way switch configuration.But in the end, lesson learned and experience / wisdom was gained.

customer_reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on February 22, 2025
customer_reviews.review_snippet: Same as store near by but better price and more quality since individually wrapped no scratches or stain

customer_reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on February 4, 2025
